text:
"Yes, yes, of course, Rodion Romanovitch! I was just getting to that. I asked a lot of people about you. I really felt bad about how I acted before. I learned later that you are a writer and a smart person. So, I guess we all start off a bit differently! My wife and I really respect literature. For her, it’s a true passion! If a man is a gentleman, he can gain everything else through talent, knowledge, and good sense. A hat? Well, it doesn’t matter much. I can buy a hat as easily as I can buy a bun, but what’s inside the hat, what’s under it, I can’t buy that! I even wanted to come and say sorry to you, but I thought maybe you’d… But I forgot to ask, do you need anything? I heard your family has come?’

‘Yes, my mother and sister.’

‘I even had the honor of meeting your sister—she’s a very educated and lovely person. I admit I was sorry for getting so angry with you. But about me looking suspicious when you fainted—that's all cleared up now! It was just bigotry and fanaticism! I understand why you were upset. Are you thinking about changing where you live because your family is here?’

‘No, I just stopped by… I came to ask… I thought I would find Zametov here.’

‘Oh, yes! I heard you made friends. Well, no, Zametov isn’t here. We’ve lost track of him. He hasn’t been here since yesterday… he had a fight with everyone.’"

**PAGE SUMMARY:** A character expresses regret for past behavior and discusses the importance of character over appearance in the context of literature and personal relationships.
